data.text: @DublinAirport @roinnslainte Is that the truth? I do not have to take a test when I fly to Dublin tomorrow?
@DublinAirport @roinnslainte Ye are fuckin the people that support ye again welcome to Ireland where u get fucked for dropping ur family off on holidays
@mrshanemcdonald No problem. Safe travels. ESTAs at short notice are not good for the heart.

@rmurph01 Thanks Ray ,  Much appreciated.
I haven't been over in 20 years - pre-digital, when you had to complete the little green forms during the flight.
Just sorting out ESTAs and Covid tests is very messy at short notice.
Thanks again for the details !!

@mrshanemcdonald I’ve done this trip a few times. You don’t do pre clearance in Dublin as you’ll do it when you land in the US. It’s a bit of a pain and the queues are generally a lot longer in the US.

@DublinAirport @roinnslainte I'm flying from Dublin to Schipol (AMS) and then from AMS to the USA (same day flight).

Do I do the US Immigration Pre-Clearance in Dublin?
@guides_way @DublinAirport @roinnslainte Check the countries you are travelling to ,to see their rules, and check ours  before you come home….. it could change again… you never know
@DublinAirport @roinnslainte Do we still need to wear masks in airport and on flight??? Surely that's gone also?

@DublinAirport @roinnslainte Just heard an announcement in Dublin Airport that face coverings are mandatory. About 50% of people here don't seem to know that. Explaine please?  Either they are or theu are not.
